thread.title: Mexico rises to 30th place in Tourism Competitive IndexTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Mexico rises to 30th place in Tourism Competitive IndexTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Mexico rises to 30th place in Tourism Competitive IndexTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Mexico rises to 30th place in Tourism Competitive Index Published on : Tuesday, September 1, 2015
In recent times Mexico has witnessed sharp growth in the tourism industry, which is one of the principal drivers of the national economy.
For the first time since 2007, Mexico went from 44th to 30th place in the Travel and Tourism Competitive Index.
Mexico welcomed 29.1 million foreign tourists in 2014, generating $16.25 billion in revenues.
A number of factors resulted in the boost in tourism industry. More Mexican vacationers opting for domestic tourism as well as promotional campaigns have aided in the progress of tourism industry in the country.
Mexican Association of Hotels and Motels (AMHM) President Rafael García González in an interview to Mexican Media Corporation CAPTIAL MEDIA cited the promotional campaign “Viva para creerlo” (Live it to believe it) has been well executed and positioned at an international level. In addition, cultural exchanges between Mexico and other countries have provided strong momentum to the tourism sector.
Riding strong on the confidence, the hotel industry hopes to close 2015 with 5 percent growth in the number of visitors and room occupancy increasing from 60 to 65 percent.
